verses.roman:
so 'pi vavre 'calāṁ bhaktiṁ
tasminn evākhilātmani
tad-bhakteṣu ca sauhārdaṁ
bhūteṣu ca dayāṁ parām

synonyms: saḥ—he; api—and; vavre—chose; acalām—unshakable; bhaktim—devotion; tasmin—to Him; eva—alone; akhila—of everything; ātmani—the Supreme Soul; tat—toward His; bhakteṣu—devotees; ca—and; sauhārdam—friendship; bhūteṣu—toward living beings in general; ca—and; dayām—mercy; parām—transcendental.
translation: Sudāmā chose unshakable devotion for Kṛṣṇa, the Supreme Soul of all existence; friendship with His devotees; and transcendental compassion for all living beings.
